title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cooking_instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Reserve some pasta water and then drain the pasta.
In a pan, cook the pancetta or bacon until crispy. Add the garlic cloves for flavor, then remove them before adding the pasta.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and mix in the grated Pecorino and Parmesan cheese. Season with a little black pepper.

Add the hot pasta to the pan with pancetta and toss to combine. Remove from heat and quickly pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring vigorously to create a creamy sauce. If needed, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra cheese and chopped parsley if desired.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
cooking_instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and chili powder. Add chicken cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat a grill or oven to medium-high heat. Thread the chicken onto skewers and grill until cooked through and slightly charred. Set aside.
In a large pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, cooking for another minute.
Add canned tomatoes and cook until the oil starts to separate from the mixture. Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the grilled chicken pieces to the sauce and cook for another 5-10 minutes until heated through. Season with salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy mix of fresh vegetables sautéed in a savory sauce.
cooking_instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger, sautéing for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the bell peppers, broccoli, carrot, and zucchini to the pan. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), and sesame oil. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce is heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately over cooked rice or noodles.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Seasoned ground beef served in crispy taco shells with fresh toppings.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or Mexican blend)
cooking_instructions: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Add chopped onion and garlic to the skillet, cooking until softened.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Warm the taco shells or tortillas according to package instructions.
Fill each taco shell with a portion of the seasoned beef mixture. Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: Crisp romaine lettuce tossed with Caesar dressing, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
cooking_instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce and Caesar dressing. Toss to coat the lettuce evenly.
Add croutons and grated Parmesan cheese to the salad. Toss gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges on the side for extra flavor.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic cookies loaded with chocolate chips, perfect for any occasion.
cooking_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: A simple yet delicious pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
cooking_instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C). If using a pizza stone, place it in the oven to heat up.
On a floured surface, roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness. Transfer it to a piece of parchment paper for easy handling.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Arrange the sliced mozzarella and tomatoes on top of the sauce. Season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza and add fresh basil leaves.
Transfer the pizza (with parchment paper) onto the preheated pizza stone or a baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp
summary: Juicy shrimp cooked in a zesty lemon garlic sauce, served over rice or pasta.
cooking_instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet in a single layer. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until they turn pink and opaque.
Stir in lemon juice, lemon zest, and chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook for another minute to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve the lemon garlic shrimp over cooked rice or pasta, garnished with extra parsley if desired.

title: Pancakes with Maple Syrup
summary: Fluffy pancakes served with a drizzle of pure maple syrup and fresh berries.
cooking_instructions: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, and melted butter. Mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancakes and the edges are dry. Flip and cook until browned on the other side.
Serve hot with a drizzle of maple syrup and fresh berries on top.

title: Greek Yogurt Parfait
summary: Layers of creamy Greek yogurt, fresh fruit, and granola for a healthy breakfast or snack.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed fresh berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
cooking_instructions: In serving glasses or bowls, start by adding a layer of Greek yogurt.
Add a layer of mixed fresh berries on top of the yogurt.
Sprinkle a layer of granola over the berries.
Repeat the layers until the glasses are filled, finishing with a layer of granola on top.
Drizzle honey over the parfaits if desired.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves and serve immediately.

title: Avocado Toast
summary: Toasted bread topped with mashed avocado, a sprinkle of salt, and a dash of chili flakes.
ingredients: 2 slices of bread (whole grain or sourdough)
Fresh herbs (like cilantro or parsley, for garnish)
cooking_instructions: Toast the bread slices to your desired level of crispiness.
In a bowl, mash the ripe avocado with lemon juice and salt until smooth but still slightly chunky.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread slices.
Sprinkle chili flakes on top if you like a bit of heat.
Garnish with fresh herbs and serve immediately.

title: Minestrone Soup
summary: A hearty Italian vegetable soup with beans, pasta, and a rich tomato broth.
ingredients: 1 can (400g) cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup small pasta (like ditalini or elbow macaroni)
cooking_instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, sautéing until softened.
Add diced carrots and celery, cooking for another 5 minutes until they begin to soften.
Stir in zucchini and green beans, cooking for an additional 3 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes (with juice) and vegetable broth to the pot. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the cannellini beans, pasta, dried oregano, and dried basil. Cook until the pasta is al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
